1: By the rivers of Babylon we sit down and weep[b] when we remember Zion.
2: On the poplars in her midst we hang our harps,
3: for there our captors ask us to compose songs;[c] those who mock us demand that we be happy, saying:[d] “Sing for us a song about Zion!”[e]
4: How can we sing a song to the Lord in a foreign land?
5: If I forget you, O Jerusalem, may my right hand be crippled.[f]
6: May my tongue stick to the roof of my mouth, if I do not remember you, and do not give Jerusalem priority over whatever gives me the most joy.[g]
7: Remember, O Lord, what the Edomites did on the day Jerusalem fell.[h] They said, “Tear it down, tear it down,[i] right to its very foundation!”
8: O daughter Babylon, soon to be devastated,[j] how blessed will be the one who repays you for what you dished out to us.[k]
9: How blessed will be the one who grabs your babies and smashes them on a rock.[l]
